alert.note: Alert for Jackson (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 16 at 8:15AM CDT until May 18 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Texas... San Bernard River Near East Bernard affecting Wharton, Austin, Colorado and Fort Bend Counties. San Bernard River near Boling affecting Wharton, Brazoria and Fort Bend Counties. ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Texas... Lavaca River near Edna affecting Jackson County. For the San Bernard River...including East Bernard, Sweeny, Boling... Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Lavaca River...including Edna...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY THURSDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Lavaca River near Edna. * WHEN...Until early Thursday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 25.0 feet, Moderate lowland flooding begins with the river one third of a mile wide near the Highway 59 bridge flooding secondary roads and bridges along the river. Livestock are isolated and potentially drown. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:15 AM CDT Tuesday the stage was 25.9 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:15 AM CDT Tuesday was 26.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage early Thursday morning and continue falling to 12.5 feet Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 21.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 25.6 feet on 09/10/2010. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (7 am CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Wed Thu Fri Lavaca River Edna 21.0 25.9 Tue 7 am CDT 23.9 19.6 17.0 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1000 PM CDT.
